thread.title: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley says only a matter of time before GST is passed
thread.title_full: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley says only a matter of time before GST is passed | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Finance Minister Arun Jaitley says only a matter of time before GST is passed
text:
Other Articles Govt seeks to resolve tax disputes quickly: Arun Jaitley China's shifting economy mints US corporate winners, losers Narendra Modi tells billionaires 'invest'; leaves Jim Rogers unimpressed Finance Minister Arun Jaitley has said that it is only a matter of time before goods and services tax (GST) is passed as almost all parties are supporting it. He further added that he still wants to implement a new GST by next April 1.
The GST has failed to clear Parliament due to an opposition in the Rajya Sabha by the Congress party.
He was speaking at the Economist Indian Summit being held in New Delhi on Wednesday.
He also said that it was important to stay on the path of reform and build momentum to achieve a higher level of growth amid global economic turmoil.
Below are the highlights from his speech
-Only a matter of time before GST is passed; almost all parties are supporting it
– India doing reasonably well in global turmoil and can embark on a much higher growth
– NPAs in banking sector matter of concern, but there is no ground to panic as solution to the problem in sight
– Examining steps to prevent dumping in the steel sector
– Black money is a problem confined to a few individuals
– Govt will not be soft on black money; it is the fundamental right of a country to get the black money into the banking system
-Less than 1% of those individuals who file taxes face scrutiny
– Govt has no intention of retrospective taxation. It’s been put to rest
 09, 2015 10:16 am © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
